document.docAuthor: Chen, Xi-Peng, Gao, Jian-Jun & Chen, Hong-Wei
document.docTitle: Stegana (Steganina) xanthosticta Chen & Gao & Chen 2009, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The Stegana shirozui species group (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Stegana shirozui species group (Diptera, Drosophilidae) from East Asia

caption.paragraph:
Figures 63–69.
Stegana ( Steganina ) xanthosticta
sp. nov. , Ƌ. (63) Epandrium, surstylus and cercus; (64) surstylus; (65) tenth sternite; (66, 67) hypandrium, aedeagus and aedeagal apodeme; (68, 69) gonopods. For orientation and organization see Figures 8–14. Scale bars: 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements. BL = 2.56 mm in holotype ; ThL = 1.46 mm ; WL = 2.89 mm ; WW = 1.32 mm .

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype : Ƌ, China : Shennongjia , Hubei , 31°49’ N , 109°41’ E , altitude
1900 m
,
1 August 2005
, HW Chen ( SCAU , No. 120357).

subSubSection.paragraph: A combination of the Latin words: xanthos and stictus, referring to the scutellum yellow at tip.

paragraph.emphasis:
Key to the species of the
shirozui
species group (male)

subSubSection.paragraph:
0. Face black, with two yellow bands on median and lower margin; surstylus with one row of prensisetae submedially and serrated, minute processes; gonopods strongly sclerotized.
shirozui
species group................. 1

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Gonopods with one projection bearing serrated, minute processes on dorsomedian................................................. 2
– Gonopods without projection on dorsomedian...................... 8

2. Hypandrium with numerous, serrated processes on flaps...
qinlingensis
sp. nov.
– Hypandrium without serrated processes on laps..................... 3
3. Aedeagus without serrated, minute processes....................... 4
– Aedeagus with serrated, minute processes ........................... 5

4. Surstylus with five prensisetae submedially; hypandrium neither setulae submedially nor pubescence on flaps...................
saigusai
sp. nov.

– Surstylus with seven prensisetae submedially; hypandrium with two to three setulae submedially and a few pubescence on flaps....
xanthosticta
sp. nov.

5. Scutellum black; clypeus yellow.................... ..
shennongi
sp. nov.
– Scutellum black, yellow at tip; clypeus brown to black medially......... 6

6. First flagellomere yellow; dorsal projection of gonopods slightly roundly protruded in lateral view......................
maoershanensis
sp. nov.
– First flagellomere yellow basally, black distally; dorsal projection of gonopods strongly protruded in lateral view, as long as half high of gonopods.. 7

7. Clypeus black medially, yellow laterally; gonopods acute apically in ventral view........................................…
wuyishanensis
sp. nov.

– Clypeus brown, dark medially; gonopods round apically in ventral view..............................................
jiajinshanensis
sp. nov.
8. Paramere undistinguishable; aedeagus without finely serrated processes.. 9
– Paramere present; aedeagus with one pair of finely serrated processes... 10

9. Gonopods and hypandrium with serrated, minute processes each apically and medially; gonopods round apically; aedeagal opening slightly triangular in ventral view; with tentacle-like setae on posteromedian..............................................
masanoritodai Okada and Sidorenko

– Gonopods and hypandrium without serrated, minute processes; gonopods acute apically; aedeagal opening nearly quadrate in ventral view, without tentacle-like setae on posteromedian.................... shiorzui Okada

10. Scutellum black, yellow at tip; epandrium broadened on posterior margins, wider than 3/5 high; aedeagal opening rhombic in ventral view.......................................................
multidentata
sp. nov.

– Scutellum dark brown to black; epandrium not broadened on posterior margins, approximately as high as double width; aedeagal opening oval in ventral view....................................
ctenaria Nishiharu

subSubSection.paragraph: The body colour pattern is well diversified in this group, as depicted in detail in Table 1 . Some body parts show discrete variations of colouration among species, thus

caption.paragraph:
Table 1. Examination of variation of body coloration among species of the
shirozui
species group.

subSubSection.paragraph: enabling one to distinguish them from one another based on a combination of colourations on different parts.
